description:
The natural logarithm is the logarithm to the base *e* of the number `x`, which equals to using the *log* process with the base set to *e*. The natural logarithm is the inverse function of taking *e* to the power x.

The no-data value `null` is passed through.

The computations follow [IEEE Standard 754](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8766229) whenever the processing environment supports it. Therefore, *`ln(0)`* results in Â±infinity if the processing environment supports it or otherwise an exception is thrown.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: A number to compute the natural logarithm for.

links.title: Natural logarithm explained by Wolfram MathWorld
